effect_entries: Gives a high number of appeal points wth no other effects.
flavor_text_entries: A highly appealing move.

effect_entries: If the Pokémon that appealed before the user earned less than three appeal points, user earns six; if three, user earns three; if more than three, user earns none.
flavor_text_entries: Affected by how well the appeal in front goes.

effect_entries: If the user is jammed this turn after using this move, it will receive twice as many jam points.
flavor_text_entries: After this move, the user is more easily startled.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam the Pokémon that appealed before the user.
flavor_text_entries: Badly startles the Pokémon in front.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
flavor_text_entries: Badly startles those that have made appeals.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam the other Pokémon.  The user cannot make an appeal on the next turn, but it cannot be jammed either.
flavor_text_entries: Jams the others, and misses one turn of appeals.

effect_entries: User cannot make any more appeals for the remainder of the contest.
flavor_text_entries: Makes a great appeal, but allows no more to the end.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
flavor_text_entries: Startles all Pokémon that have done their appeals.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam the Pokémon that appealed before the user.
flavor_text_entries: Startles the Pokémon that appealed before the user.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.  If a Pokémon is in combo standby status, it is jammed 5 points instead of 1.
flavor_text_entries: Startles the Pokémon that has the judge's attention.

effect_entries: If the Applause meter is empty or at one, earns one point; if two, earns three points; if three, earns four points; if four, earns six points.
flavor_text_entries: The appeal works best the more the crowd is excited.

effect_entries: If the last Pokémon's appeal is the same type as this move, user earns six points instead of two.
flavor_text_entries: Works well if it's the same type as the one before.

effect_entries: Always adds a point to the applause meter, regardless of whether the move matches the contest, and can likewise gain the applause bonus.
flavor_text_entries: An appeal that excites the audience in any contest.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn for half their appeal points (minimum 1).
flavor_text_entries: Badly startles all Pokémon that made good appeals.

effect_entries: Prevents jamming for the rest of this turn.
flavor_text_entries: Can avoid being startled by others.

effect_entries: Prevents the next jam on this turn.
flavor_text_entries: Can avoid being startled by others once.

effect_entries: Repeated use does not incur a penalty.
flavor_text_entries: Can be repeatedly used without boring the judge.

effect_entries: Attempts to make all following Pokémon nervous (and thus unable to appeal).
flavor_text_entries: Makes all Pokémon after the user nervous.

effect_entries: User earns appeal points equal to the points the previous Pokémon earned plus one.
flavor_text_entries: Makes the appeal as good as the one before it.

effect_entries: User earns appeal points equal to half the points ALL the previous Pokémon earned plus one.
flavor_text_entries: Makes the appeal as good as those before it.

effect_entries: Shuffles the next turn's turn order.
flavor_text_entries: Scrambles up the order of appeals on the next turn.

effect_entries: Cancels combo standby status for all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
flavor_text_entries: Shifts the judge's attention from others.

effect_entries: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.  If a Pokémon used the same type move as this one, it is jammed for 4 points instead of 1.
flavor_text_entries: Startles Pokémon that made a same-type appeal.

effect_entries: Prevents the Applause Meter from rising for the rest of the turn.
flavor_text_entries: Temporarily stops the crowd from getting excited.

effect_entries: Randomly earns one, two, four, or eight points.
flavor_text_entries: The appeal's quality depends on its timing.

effect_entries: If user appeals first this turn, earns one point; if second, two points; if third, four points; if last, six points.
flavor_text_entries: The appeal works better the later it is performed.

effect_entries: If user appeals first this turn, earns six points instead of two.
flavor_text_entries: The appeal works great if performed first.

effect_entries: If user appeals last this turn, earns six points instead of two.
flavor_text_entries: The appeal works great if performed last.

effect_entries: If user has no stars, earns one point; if one, three points; if two, five points; if three, seven points.  This does not include the appeal point bonus the stars give.
flavor_text_entries: The appeal works well if the user's condition is good.

effect_entries: User will go first next turn.
flavor_text_entries: The next appeal can be made earlier next turn.

effect_entries: User will go last next turn.
flavor_text_entries: The next appeal can be made later next turn.

effect_entries: User gains one star.
flavor_text_entries: Ups the user's condition.  Helps prevent nervousness.

effect_entries: Removes all stars from all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
flavor_text_entries: Worsens the condition of those that made appeals.
